 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;

  a.button, .button {

    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;

          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts

          </button>
        <h2>
          Issue tracker keyboard shortcuts
          <button class="close-button">
            Close
          </button>
        </h2>
        
          
            
              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                up/down in the list<span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    o<kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    Enter<kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                open the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    Shift-O<kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)

    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<span class="line"><!---->When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<span class="line"><!---->1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<!----></span><br>2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>3. Right click the omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->3. Right click the omnibox.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<span class="line"><!---->After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<!----></span><br><br>1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<span class="line"><!---->1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<!----></span><br><br>2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <span class="line"><!---->2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <!----></span>comment 9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c9"><!---->comment 9<!----></a> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<span class="line"><!----> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<!----></span><br><br>[5] <span class="line"><!---->[5] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<span class="line"><!---->My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<!----></span><br><br>So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<span class="line"><!---->So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<!----></a><br><br>I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, I think orinj@ is right. Sorry I didn't notice that |SanitizeTextForPaste| is a static function. After analysis again, I found that the UAF problem of this issue occurred in the access to |items_|[1]. Of course, the access to |model()| mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Yes, I think orinj@ is right. Sorry I didn't notice that |SanitizeTextForPaste| is a static function.         Access to items_.size()[1]. After |IsCommandIdEnabled|[2]=>Textfield::IsCommandIdEnabled=>OmniboxViewViews::IsCommandIdEnabled=>GetClipboardText=>nested message loop.<span class="line"><!---->Access to items_.size()[1].         Fixes sent out for review in <span class="line"><!---->Fixes sent out for review in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2619204<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2619204"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2619204<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<span class="line"><!----> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<!----></span><br><br>Note also that there's some activity now on <span class="line"><!---->Note also that there's some activity now on <!----></span>https://crbug.com/443355<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=443355" title="Switch base/ clipboard APIs to be asynchronous"><!---->https://crbug.com/443355<!----></a>, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<span class="line"><!---->, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

scope-exiting<!----></span><br>reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<span class="line"><!---->reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<!----></span><br>deleted.<span class="line"><!---->deleted.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1161149<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161149" title="Security:            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {

 }
 }
 });

    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);

        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {

          bottom: 1em;

          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-header></mr-header>
      <chops-announcement service="monorail"></chops-announcement>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };

 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 function _go(url, newWindow) {
 if (newWindow)
 window.open(url, '_blank');
 else
 document.location = url;
 }
 function $(id) { return document.getElementById(id); }
 var loadQueue = [];
 function runOnLoad(fn) { loadQueue.push(fn); }
 window.onload = function() {
 for (var i = 0; i < loadQueue.length; i++)
 loadQueue[i]();
 delete loadQueue;
 };
</script>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)

    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<span class="line"><!---->When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<span class="line"><!---->1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<!----></span><br>2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>3. Right click the omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->3. Right click the omnibox.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<span class="line"><!---->After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<!----></span><br><br>1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<span class="line"><!---->1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<!----></span><br><br>2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <span class="line"><!---->2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <!----></span>comment 9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c9"><!---->comment 9<!----></a> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<span class="line"><!----> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<!----></span><br><br>[5] <span class="line"><!---->[5] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<span class="line"><!---->My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<!----></span><br><br>So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<span class="line"><!---->So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<!----></a><br><br>I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, I think orinj@ is right. Sorry I didn't notice that |SanitizeTextForPaste| is a static function. After analysis again, I found that the UAF problem of this issue occurred in the access to |items_|[1]. Of course, the access to |model()| mentioned in <span class="line"><!---->Yes, I think orinj@ is right. Sorry I didn't notice that |SanitizeTextForPaste| is a static function.         Access to items_.size()[1]. After |IsCommandIdEnabled|[2]=>Textfield::IsCommandIdEnabled=>OmniboxViewViews::IsCommandIdEnabled=>GetClipboardText=>nested message loop.<span class="line"><!---->Access to items_.size()[1].         Fixes sent out for review in <span class="line"><!---->Fixes sent out for review in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2619204<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2619204"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2619204<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<span class="line"><!----> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<!----></span><br><br>Note also that there's some activity now on <span class="line"><!---->Note also that there's some activity now on <!----></span>https://crbug.com/443355<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=443355" title="Switch base/ clipboard APIs to be asynchronous"><!---->https://crbug.com/443355<!----></a>, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<span class="line"><!---->, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

scope-exiting<!----></span><br>reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<span class="line"><!---->reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<!----></span><br>deleted.<span class="line"><!---->deleted.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1161149<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161149" title="Security:            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.
