    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    max-width: 100%;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {

 }
 }
 });

    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;

    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<span class="line"><!---->When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<span class="line"><!---->1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<!----></span><br>2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>3. Right click the omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->3. Right click the omnibox.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161146#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161146#c5"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161146#c5<!----></a> for an example of how an attacker could manipulate the clipboard to make this exploitable. The process is somewhat convoluted so while this is accessible from a web context it will be difficult to exploit, so setting severity=High.<span class="line"><!----> for an example of how an attacker could manipulate the clipboard to make this exploitable. The process is somewhat convoluted so while this is accessible from a web context it will be difficult to exploit, so setting severity=High.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<span class="line"><!---->After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<!----></span><br><br>1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<span class="line"><!---->1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<!----></span><br><br>2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <span class="line"><!---->2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <!----></span>comment 9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c9"><!---->comment 9<!----></a> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<span class="line"><!----> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<!----></span><br><br>[5] <span class="line"><!---->[5] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 29, 2020, 3:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 29, 2020, 3:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<span class="line"><!---->My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<!----></span><br><br>So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<span class="line"><!---->So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<!----></a><br><br>I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        I thought I had read that class definitions were dynamically loaded on first creation of an instance of the class and potentially dellocated as well. Your theory about the UAF actually being after the return seems plausible. I should just get an asan build going and try it out.<span class="line"><!---->I thought I had read that class definitions were dynamically loaded on first creation of an instance of the class and potentially dellocated as well.         Fixes sent out for review in <span class="line"><!---->Fixes sent out for review in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2619204<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2619204"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2619204<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<span class="line"><!----> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<!----></span><br><br>Note also that there's some activity now on <span class="line"><!---->Note also that there's some activity now on <!----></span>https://crbug.com/443355<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=443355" title="Switch base/ clipboard APIs to be asynchronous"><!---->https://crbug.com/443355<!----></a>, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<span class="line"><!---->, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b"><!---->4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<!----></a><br>Author: Justin Donnelly <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Justin Donnelly &lt;<!----></span>jdonnelly@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jdonnelly@chromium.org"><!---->jdonnelly@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jan 13 20:07:35 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jan 13 20:07:35 2021<!----></span><br><br>[omnibox] Fix Views clipboard access issues on Linux.<span class="line"><!---->[omnibox] Fix Views clipboard access issues on Linux.<!----></span><br><br>Includes one behavioral change, no longer disabling the ability to paste<span class="line"><!---->Includes one behavioral change, no longer disabling the ability to paste<!----></span><br>via keyboard shortcuts when the clipboard is empty. This change<span class="line"><!---->via keyboard shortcuts when the clipboard is empty. This change<!----></span><br>simplifies the code, reducing the number of points of access to the<span class="line"><!---->simplifies the code, reducing the number of points of access to the<!----></span><br>clipboard and removing the need for an auto-reset bool to control<span class="line"><!---->clipboard and removing the need for an auto-reset bool to control<!----></span><br>whether the user is notified of restricted clipboard access. The removal<span class="line"><!---->whether the user is notified of restricted clipboard access. The removal<!----></span><br>of the auto-reset bool is especially important as the scope-exiting<span class="line"><!---->of the auto-reset bool is especially important as the scope-exiting<!----></span><br>reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<span class="line"><!---->reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<!----></span><br>deleted.<span class="line"><!---->deleted.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1161149<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161149" title="Security:         mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);

        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;

        }

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }

    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

  * appropriate heading levels.

  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;

  }

    filter: brightness(95%);

  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  .medium-heading {

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);

    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by leecraso@gmail.com (Dec 22, 2020)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<span class="line"><!---->When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<span class="line"><!---->1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<!----></span><br>2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>3. Right click the omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->3. Right click the omnibox.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        See <span class="line"><!---->See <!----></span>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161146#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161146#c5"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161146#c5<!----></a> for an example of how an attacker could manipulate the clipboard to make this exploitable. The process is somewhat convoluted so while this is accessible from a web context it will be difficult to exploit, so setting severity=High.<span class="line"><!----> for an example of how an attacker could manipulate the clipboard to make this exploitable. The process is somewhat convoluted so while this is accessible from a web context it will be difficult to exploit, so setting severity=High.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<span class="line"><!---->After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<!----></span><br><br>1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<span class="line"><!---->1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<!----></span><br><br>2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <span class="line"><!---->2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <!----></span>comment 9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c9"><!---->comment 9<!----></a> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<span class="line"><!----> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<!----></span><br><br>[5] <span class="line"><!---->[5] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 29, 2020, 3:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 29, 2020, 3:15 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<span class="line"><!---->My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<!----></span><br><br>So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<span class="line"><!---->So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<!----></a><br><br>I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        I thought I had read that class definitions were dynamically loaded on first creation of an instance of the class and potentially dellocated as well. Your theory about the UAF actually being after the return seems plausible. I should just get an asan build going and try it out.<span class="line"><!---->I thought I had read that class definitions were dynamically loaded on first creation of an instance of the class and potentially dellocated as well.         Fixes sent out for review in <span class="line"><!---->Fixes sent out for review in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2619204<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2619204"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2619204<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<span class="line"><!----> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<!----></span><br><br>Note also that there's some activity now on <span class="line"><!---->Note also that there's some activity now on <!----></span>https://crbug.com/443355<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=443355" title="Switch base/ clipboard APIs to be asynchronous"><!---->https://crbug.com/443355<!----></a>, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<span class="line"><!---->, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b"><!---->4e7cf9058723fff0da3ae99202cffb9bc97dd48b<!----></a><br>Author: Justin Donnelly <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Justin Donnelly &lt;<!----></span>jdonnelly@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jdonnelly@chromium.org"><!---->jdonnelly@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jan 13 20:07:35 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jan 13 20:07:35 2021<!----></span><br><br>[omnibox] Fix Views clipboard access issues on Linux.<span class="line"><!---->[omnibox] Fix Views clipboard access issues on Linux.<!----></span><br><br>Includes one behavioral change, no longer disabling the ability to paste<span class="line"><!---->Includes one behavioral change, no longer disabling the ability to paste<!----></span><br>via keyboard shortcuts when the clipboard is empty. This change<span class="line"><!---->via keyboard shortcuts when the clipboard is empty. This change<!----></span><br>simplifies the code, reducing the number of points of access to the<span class="line"><!---->simplifies the code, reducing the number of points of access to the<!----></span><br>clipboard and removing the need for an auto-reset bool to control<span class="line"><!---->clipboard and removing the need for an auto-reset bool to control<!----></span><br>whether the user is notified of restricted clipboard access. The removal<span class="line"><!---->whether the user is notified of restricted clipboard access. The removal<!----></span><br>of the auto-reset bool is especially important as the scope-exiting<span class="line"><!---->of the auto-reset bool is especially important as the scope-exiting<!----></span><br>reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<span class="line"><!---->reset will always cause a memory access even if the view has been<!----></span><br>deleted.<span class="line"><!---->deleted.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1161149<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1161149" title="Security:         mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {

          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
