      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<span class="line"><!---->When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<span class="line"><!---->1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<!----></span><br>2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>3. Right click the omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->3. Right click the omnibox.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Ok, gave this some more thought and it looks like, since the issue is the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4], I can move that out of |GetClipboardText|[2] and have the callers run it instead after checking that they haven't been freed.<span class="line"><!---->Ok, gave this some more thought and it looks like, since the issue is the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4], I can move that out of |GetClipboardText|[2] and have the callers run it instead after checking that they haven't been freed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 10<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      jdonnelly@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1522314707" title="jdonnelly@chromium.org"><!---->jdonnelly@chromium.org<!----></a>
      jdonnelly@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->jdonnelly@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>

    <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 29, 2020, 10:56 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 29, 2020, 10:56 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1161149#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, Dec 29, 2020, 10:56 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Linux
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Linux
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<span class="line"><!---->After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<!----></span><br><br>1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<span class="line"><!---->1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<!----></span><br><br>2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <span class="line"><!---->2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <!----></span>comment 9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c9"><!---->comment 9<!----></a> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<span class="line"><!----> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<!----></span><br><br>[5] <span class="line"><!---->[5] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<span class="line"><!---->My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<!----></span><br><br>So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<span class="line"><!---->So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<!----></a><br><br>I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Fixes sent out for review in <span class="line"><!---->Fixes sent out for review in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2619204<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2619204"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2619204<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<span class="line"><!----> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<!----></span><br><br>Note also that there's some activity now on <span class="line"><!---->Note also that there's some activity now on <!----></span>https://crbug.com/443355<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=443355" title="Switch base/ clipboard APIs to be asynchronous"><!---->https://crbug.com/443355<!----></a>, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<span class="line"><!---->, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br><br>When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<span class="line"><!---->When right-clicking the Omnibox, the browser will check whether the clipboard is empty[1] and whether it can be PasteAndGo to create a menu. And |GetClipboardText|[2] will run a nested message loop[3] to continue running the UI thread. If the OmniboxViewViews is destroyed, the UAF will be triggered when accessing |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] after the nested message loops exit. (Asan throw it out as heap-buffer-overflow)<!----></span><br><br>[1]. <span class="line"><!---->[1]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;l=1992;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462<!----></a><br>[2]. <span class="line"><!---->[2]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=24;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br>[3]. <span class="line"><!---->[3]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:ui/base/x/selection_requestor.cc;l=249;drc=eafec8441d8c6343f3d23a05a72da5835f4c87e4<!----></a><br>[4]. <span class="line"><!---->[4]. <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=26;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux<!----></span><br><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<span class="line"><!---->1. Copy a lot of content(I used about 300M) from a non-chrome window.<!----></span><br>2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<span class="line"><!---->2. $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer<!----></span><br>   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<span class="line"><!---->   $ out/asan/chrome --user-data-dir=/tmp/xxxx "<!----></span>http://localhost:8000/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/poc.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/poc.html<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span><br>3. Right click the omnibox.<span class="line"><!---->3. Right click the omnibox.<!----></span><br><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State: see asan file<span class="line"><!---->Crash State: see asan file<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Leecraso and Guang Gong of 360 Alpha Lab<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Ok, gave this some more thought and it looks like, since the issue is the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4], I can move that out of |GetClipboardText|[2] and have the callers run it instead after checking that they haven't been freed.<span class="line"><!---->Ok, gave this some more thought and it looks like, since the issue is the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4], I can move that out of |GetClipboardText|[2] and have the callers run it instead after checking that they haven't been freed.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<span class="line"><!---->After playing around with this for a bit, I have a couple questions I'm hoping someone here can help answer.<!----></span><br><br>1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<span class="line"><!---->1. The case described here is only one instance of 7 uses of GetClipboardText. I assume they all have to be protected by checking a weak pointer to the omnibox view after calling them? Is there any alternative way of building GetClipboardText so that it's easier to use without introducing a possible UAF?<!----></span><br><br>2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <span class="line"><!---->2. Moving the call to |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] out of |GetClipboardText| as I suggested in <!----></span>comment 9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c9"><!---->comment 9<!----></a> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<span class="line"><!----> is not sufficient, because there is another case in that method with similar logic that returns after calling |StripJavascriptSchemas|[5] instead. The failure on calling |SanitizeTextForPaste|[4] is because that's a static method whose definition is no longer available when the omnibox view (the instance of the class where the static method is defined) is destroyed, correct? If these 2 static methods (|SanitizeTextForPaste| and |StripJavascriptSchemas| were converted into regular functions would that prevent the UAF inside |GetClipboardText|? (The return sites after the call to |GetClipboardText| would still need to protect against the view potentially having been destroyed.)<!----></span><br><br>[5] <span class="line"><!---->[5] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/omnibox/clipboard_utils.cc;l=44;drc=281086aeca412de952c180411560c7ca68a5b97b<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<span class="line"><!---->My super-deep C++ knowledge has rusted a bit, so I could be wrong here (let me know if/how I am!), but I don't see the UAF happening due to static function access. Changing it to a normal function won't help because it already is a normal function with no implicit `this` context. How does the static function definition become unavailable? Is a DLL being unloaded? A process terminating? An instance being destroyed should have no effect on the presence and availability of static methods in its class or others. An OmniboxViewViews instance going away shouldn't kill an OmniboxView static method, right?<!----></span><br><br>So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<span class="line"><!---->So I don't see the UAF exactly as reported, but I do think I see a UAF. It's happening just *after* the call to `SanitizeTextForPaste`; when execution returns to `IsCommandIdEnabled`. The parameter gets built before invoking a method call on `this` which has been destroyed. See:<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:chrome/browser/ui/views/omnibox/omnibox_view_views.cc;drc=8a8ddf4a29a3d36b0c68b23a220db4c462717462;l=1995<!----></a><br><br>I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tested this theory, I'm just peeking at the code and could be wrong. Would be very interested to learn how this heap buffer overflow UAF is happening on static method access.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        leecraso: Thanks for the additional info.<span class="line"><!---->leecraso: Thanks for the additional info.<!----></span><br><br>So, unfortunately, a simple fix in the omnibox view code won't suffice since there are multiple points of access while building the menu.<span class="line"><!---->So, unfortunately, a simple fix in the omnibox view code won't suffice since there are multiple points of access while building the menu.<!----></span><br><br>Turns out that this X message loop issue has been known for some time: <span class="line"><!---->Turns out that this X message loop issue has been known for some time: <!----></span>https://crbug.com/443355<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=443355" title="Switch base/ clipboard APIs to be asynchronous"><!---->https://crbug.com/443355<!----></a>. I'll see if I can figure out some point of intervention in the views code here, similar to what tommycli did in <span class="line"><!---->. I'll see if I can figure out some point of intervention in the views code here, similar to what tommycli did in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/1512292<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/1512292"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/1512292<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Fixes sent out for review in <span class="line"><!---->Fixes sent out for review in <!----></span>https://crrev.com/c/2619204<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2619204"><!---->https://crrev.com/c/2619204<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<span class="line"><!----> I gave up on the fix for the copy case (the omnibox view access the clipboard *after* a copy in OnAfterCutOrCopy in order to manipulate the data on the clipboard). This case was trickier to address than I anticipated and I think it's a lesser issue given that there's a limit to how much data can be stored in the omnibox text field and then copied to the clipboard. (Therefore a smaller window of time where a user can close the window and producing a UAF.) I'll try to return to this later after landing the fix for the more serious paste issues.<!----></span><br><br>Note also that there's some activity now on <span class="line"><!---->Note also that there's some activity now on <!----></span>https://crbug.com/443355<a class="" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=443355" title="Switch base/ clipboard APIs to be asynchronous"><!---->https://crbug.com/443355<!----></a>, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<span class="line"><!---->, where it looks like there may be a solution in the works to solve the underlying issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <h3 class="medium-heading">Add issue to hotlists</h3>
    
      
      
      <input id="filter" type="text">
      <i class="material-icons">search</i>
    
      <form id="issueHotlistsForm">
        
      <div class="user-hotlists">
        
      </div>
    
        <h3 class="medium-heading">Create new hotlist</h3>
        <div class="input-grid">
          <label for="newHotlistName">New hotlist name:</label>
          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>
        
      <br>
      
    
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>
    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>


        
      <div class="snackbar-container" aria-live="polite">
        
      </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
